dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C4257671N] COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT NOTICE
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Sent: Thursday, May 24, 2007 12:48 PM To: Copyright Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C4257671N] COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT NOTICE ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT NOTICE Added by system at Thursday, May 24 2007 05:47 pm X-MailFrom: barbara.steinberg@sulake.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [216.12.192.67] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Thu May 24 17:46:58 2007 Received: (qmail 19845 invoked by alias); 24 May 2007 22:46:57 -0000 Delivered-To: abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net Received: (qmail 19842 invoked from network); 24 May 2007 22:46:57 -0000 Received: from spooling.theplanet.com (69.56.141.4) by inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net with SMTP; 24 May 2007 22:46:57 -0000 Return-path: Delivery-date: Thu, 24 May 2007 17:46:57 -0500 Received: from [172.16.220.10] (helo=DALD2EXCH01.PLANET.LOCAL) by spooling.theplanet.com (envelope-from barbara.steinberg@sulake.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1HrM59-00010h-4q for abuse@inbound.abacus.ev1servers.net; Thu, 24 May 2007 17:46:55 -0500 Received: from Exchanger.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.102]) by DALD2EXCH01.PLANET.LOCAL with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Thu, 24 May 2007 17:46:44 -0500 Received: from mailin.ev1servers.net ([207.218.222.124]) by Exchanger.ev1servers.net with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Thu, 24 May 2007 17:37:30 -0500 X-ASG-Debug-ID: 1180046245-27123-636-0 X-Barracuda-URL: http://207.218.222.124:8000/cgi-bin/mark.cgi X-ASG-Recipient-Whitelist: abuse@ev1servers.net Received: from mail.sulake.com (punk.sulake.com [193.64.35.198]) by mailin.ev1servers.net (Spam Firewall) with ESMTP id 94BDC827BA for ; Thu, 24 May 2007 17:37:30 -0500 (CDT) Received: from localhost (mail.sulake.com [193.64.35.194]) by mail.sulake.com (Postfix) with ESMTP id 957D23FC03 for ; Fri, 25 May 2007 01:37:13 +0300 (EEST) Received: from mail.sulake.com ([193.64.35.195]) by localhost (punk [193.64.35.195]) (amavisd-new, port 10024) with ESMTP id 03529-04 for ; Fri, 25 May 2007 01:37:12 +0300 (EEST) Received: from barbara (host-64-139-235-32.nctv.com [64.139.235.32]) (using TLSv1 with cipher RC4-MD5 (128/128 bits)) (No client certificate requested) by mail.sulake.com (Postfix) with ESMTP id 66CAC3FC05 for ; Fri, 25 May 2007 01:37:11 +0300 (EEST) Message-ID: <019b01c79e53$e40d4ea0$0201a8c0@barbara> From: "Barbara Steinberg" To: X-ASG-Orig-Subj: COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT NOTICE Subject: COPYRIGHT INFRINGEMENT NOTICE Date: Thu, 24 May 2007 18:35:52 -0400 MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary="----=_NextPart_000_0198_01C79E32.5BA2D560" X-Priority: 3 X-MSMail-Priority: Normal X-Mailer: Microsoft Outlook Express 6.00.2800.1409 X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft MimeOLE V6.00.2800.1409 X-Virus-Scanned: amavisd-new at sulake.com X-Virus-Scanned: by Barracuda Spam Firewall at ev1servers.net X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: 0.00 X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=0.00 using global scores of TAG_LEVEL=4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 WHITELISTED X-OriginalArrivalTime: 24 May 2007 22:37:30.0721 (UTC) FILETIME=[1D2BF510:01C79E54] (multipart/alternative) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. MIME element (text/plain) Dear Sir/Madam, A Network Inquiry brought up DotTK as hosting this site: www.noriath.com It has a retro server. The offending URL is here: www.noriath.com/client.action.html Retro servers mimic Habbo Hotel, steal our bandwith and images, and infringe on our copyright. Our copyright, listed in the Library of Congress is Registration Number: TX-6-514-407 Title: Habbo licensing program : style guide 1.0. Note: Cataloged from appl. only. Claimant: acSulake Corporation, Ltd. Created: 2006 Published: 1Feb06 Registered: 26Feb07 Special Codes: 1/B I hereby confirm that I am authorised to act on behalf of the owner of the copyright for http://www.habbohotel.co.uk. The owner of this copyright is Sulake UK Ltd. www.habbohotel.co.uk is an online graphical chat and gaming environment for teenagers. The site takes the form of a virtual hotel, where each user is represented by an avatar called a Habbo. Habbos can walk, talk and dance in all of the hotel's public and private rooms. Private rooms are created by the Habbos themselves and are furnished by them using Habbo Credits. Users purchase Habbo Credits using all the normal online payment methods, such as credit or debit cards, reverse SMS billing, premium rate phone lines and cheques. Our copyright ownership is clearly stated on the site thus: 'All rights including trademarks, copyright and database rights in this website and its contents are owned by or licensed to Sulake UK Ltd. All rights are reserved.' I have a good faith belief that the use of our material on this website is not authorised by Sulake UK Ltd, the copyright owner, or the law. I hereby confirm that all of the above information is accurate and that I am authorised to act on behalf of the copyright owner. I state this under penalty of perjury. I am thus writing to you to request that this site is removed from your servers forthwith. Please inform me when this has been effected. Yours sincerely, Barbara Steinberg Assistant Community Safety Manager Sulake Corporation MIME element (text/html)
 
Dear Sir/Madam,

A Network Inquiry brought up DotTK as hosting this site:
 
www.noriath.com

 
It has a retro server. The offending URL is here:
www.noriath.com/client. action.html
 
Retro servers mimic Habbo Hotel, steal our bandwith and images, and
infringe on our copyright.
 
Our copyright, listed in the Library of Congress is
 
Registration Number:   TX-6-514-407 Title:  
Habbo licensing program : style guide 1.0.
Note:   Cataloged from appl. only.
Claimant:   acSulake Corporation, Ltd. Created:   2006
Published:   1Feb06
Registered:   26Feb07
Special Codes:  1/B
 

I hereby confirm that I am authorised to act on behalf of the owner
of the copyright for http://www.habbohotel.co.uk. The owner of this copyright is
Sulake UK Ltd.

www.habbohotel.co.uk is an online graphical chat and gaming
environment for teenagers. The site takes the form of a virtual hotel, where
each user is represented by an avatar called a Habbo. Habbos can walk, talk
and dance in all of the hotel's public and private rooms. Private rooms
are created by the Habbos themselves and are furnished by them using Habbo
Credits. Users purchase Habbo Credits using all the normal online payment
methods, such as credit or debit cards, reverse SMS billing, premium rate phone
lines and cheques.
 
Our copyright ownership is clearly stated on the site thus:

'All rights including trademarks, copyright and database rights in
this website and its contents are owned by or licensed to Sulake UK Ltd.
All rights are reserved.'

I have a good faith belief that the use of our material on
this website is not authorised by Sulake UK Ltd, the copyright owner, or
the law.

I hereby confirm that all of the above information is accurate and
that

I am authorised to act on behalf of the copyright owner. I state
this under penalty of perjury.


I am thus writing to you to request that this site is removed
from your servers forthwith. Please inform me when this has been
effected.

Yours sincerely,

Barbara Steinberg
Assistant Community Safety Manager
Sulake Corporation
 
 
MIME element (text/plain)
